definition: to fret over the worries of long-departed people (idiom); to worry unnecessarily/crying over spilt milk/often used with negatives, e.g. no need to worry about past issues
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning
see 項莊舞劍，意在沛公|项庄舞剑，意在沛公[Xiang4 Zhuang1 wu3 jian4 , yi4 zai4 Pei4 gong1]
pinyin: Xiang4 Zhuang1 wu3 jian4 , zhi4 zai4 Pei4 gong1

definition: to intersperse comic dialogue (as they do in operas)
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
see 針尖對麥芒|针尖对麦芒[zhen1 jian1 dui4 mai4 mang2]
variant of 心拙口笨[xin1 zhuo1 kou3 ben4]
impossible to separate/impossible to disentangle/cannot take time out
to talk nonsense (idiom); saying whatever comes into his head
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good/also written 塞翁失馬焉知非福|塞翁失马焉知非福
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 an1 zhi1 fei1 fu2
